column1: There had been a full moon the night when the squad of soldiers marched out from town it was still shining brightly through the mists
column2: although it was past five o'clock. It lighted a plain two miles in extent broken by ridges and gullies and covered with thick
column3: high grass and with bunches of cactus and palmetto. In the hollow of the ridges the mist lay like broad lakes of water
column4: and on one side of the plain stood the walls of the old town. On the other rose hills covered with royal palms that showed white in the moonlight
column5: like hundreds of marble columns. A line of tiny camp fires that the sentries had built during the night stretched between the forts at regular intervals and burned brightly.But as the light grew stronger
column8: and when the soldiers came in force the moon was a white ball in the sky
column10: the fires had sunk to ashes
column11: and the sun had not yet risen.
